an6.75:4.1: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has six qualities they live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
an6.75:4.3: Sensual, malicious, and cruel thoughts and perceptions.
an6.75:4.4: When a mendicant has these six qualities they live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
an6.75:5.1: When a mendicant has six qualities they live happily in the present life—without distress, anguish, or fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.
an6.75:5.3: Thoughts of renunciation, love, and kindness. And perceptions of renunciation, love, and kindness.
an6.75:5.4: When a mendicant has these six qualities they live happily in the present life—without distress, anguish, or fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.”
